David,

Great Tip!  Thanks.

Well - In this case
I'm creating a whole bunch
of connections to ApacheDS
and then running tests.

The JNDI connections are fairly
expensive, so when running the build
in Maven it takes a while...

Thanks again for the tip.  It's a keeper.

- Ole



David Jackman wrote:
> 
> 
> Move the setup tests to a separate subclass (so the base class has only
> the setup). Is it really bad to test the setup whenever it gets
> invoked, though?
> 
> ..David..
> 
> From: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> 
> [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>] On Behalf Of
> Ole Ersoy
> Sent: Wednesday, May 30, 2007 9:45 AM
> To: junit@yahoogroups.com <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com>
> Subject: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests
> 
> Hi,
> 
> I've created
> a SetupTest class
> that just performs setup,
> but also tests the setup.
> 
> So when other test
> classes inherit from it,
> the inherited tests run
> each time.
> 
> Anyone know if I can disable the inherited tests?
> 
> Thanks,
> - Ole
> 
> [Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
> 
>
subject: Re: [junit] Disabling Inherited Tests
